[{"id":"OD-104","entityId":"2-523","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"OD"},{"name":"summary","value":"Assignment List Rework"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Garth Murray"},{"name":"created","value":"1595941963424"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"104"},{"name":"description","value":"

Rework assignments index to make managing and finding claims easier

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Rick Dupont"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"garthpmurray"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"13"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"rdupont"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1596055192070"},{"name":"State","value":["To Verify"],"valueId":["To Verify"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprints","value":["July 27 - Aug 7"],"valueId":["July 27 - Aug 7"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"rdupont","fullName":"Rick Dupont"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image1596041959537.png","id":"7-31","url":"https://youtrack.globalrisksolutions.com:443/api/files/7-31?sign=MTU5NjMyNjQwMDAwMHwxLTF8Ny0zMXwzSXc5YUdvU1czRjUyUkFJZFp5ZzNfVjJrOUVyX0lEcXQ2%0D%0Aamg2UEJ4UmdNDQo%0D%0A&updated=1596041960070"},{"value":"image1596043289844.png","id":"7-32","url":"https://youtrack.globalrisksolutions.com:443/api/files/7-32?sign=MTU5NjMyNjQwMDAwMHwxLTF8Ny0zMnxhZkRyXzhvcHltQWJjSWJheUN0dFFvWkh5Q2J3bUp0NU5p%0D%0AYTZuYTJ6UkFNDQo%0D%0A&updated=1596043290385"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"4-139","author":"rdupont","authorFullName":"Rick Dupont","issueId":"OD-104","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

The plan is to rework the index page to allow column filtering, so that at first all status and carrier options are available, and via a dropdown single status or carriers can be selected.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595962759124,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-143","author":"rdupont","authorFullName":"Rick Dupont","issueId":"OD-104","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I don't think any of the drop down options should be removed. @Justin Cook

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596040060627,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-153","author":"jcook@globalrisksolutions.com","authorFullName":"Justin Cook","issueId":"OD-104","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

We can remove the column for Completed and Add in Current Status. I would not want to remove anything else. @Rick Dupont

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596040395430,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-154","author":"jcook@globalrisksolutions.com","authorFullName":"Justin Cook","issueId":"OD-104","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

I would like current status to be right next to the claim #. @Rick Dupont

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596040465108,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-155","author":"jcook@globalrisksolutions.com","authorFullName":"Justin Cook","issueId":"OD-104","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Actually. Let's leave Completed on there. We don't display it anywhere else. @Rick Dupont

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596041007417,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-156","author":"jcook@globalrisksolutions.com","authorFullName":"Justin Cook","issueId":"OD-104","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Still add column for Current Status for we can see that when we are viewing ALL @Rick Dupont

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596041068737,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-157","author":"garthpmurray","authorFullName":"Garth Murray","issueId":"OD-104","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Which columns would you like to be made searchable but not visible?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596041157926,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-158","author":"jcook@globalrisksolutions.com","authorFullName":"Justin Cook","issueId":"OD-104","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Policy Holder's name and Address

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596041380572,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-159","author":"rdupont","authorFullName":"Rick Dupont","issueId":"OD-104","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Justin Cook and @Falin McMellon are there any columns you specifically want to have a filter for, or are there any columns you specifically don't require a filter for?

Currently I have filters for: Claim #, Status, Carrier, and Loss Type. Policy Holder name and Address are currently searchable via the Search box.

Attached is a screenshot of current progress.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596041975832,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-160","author":"rdupont","authorFullName":"Rick Dupont","issueId":"OD-104","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Falin McMellon @Justin Cook in an effort to try to save some horizontal space on the page, I gave a shot at making a general "Dates" column that listed various dates for a given assignment. What do you guys think?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596043296893,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-162","author":"jcook@globalrisksolutions.com","authorFullName":"Justin Cook","issueId":"OD-104","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Rick Dupont I would also want to be able to filter under resource so I can see all claims assigned to that person.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596043810962,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-163","author":"jcook@globalrisksolutions.com","authorFullName":"Justin Cook","issueId":"OD-104","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Rick Dupont I like that for the dates. Saves space and is very functional.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1596051392810,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"OD-89","entityId":"2-486","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"OD"},{"name":"summary","value":"Job Statuses are not updating"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Garth Murray"},{"name":"created","value":"1595601920162"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"89"},{"name":"description","value":"

Job Statuses are not updating. The just stay as Unassigned unless we manually move them. The need to update and data is put in. If I assign a field inspector, it should move to assigned. If the FI puts in an appointment D/T, it should move to Appointment Scheduled etc…..

Clarification needed - where is the source of truth for statuses (isn’t it Xact)?

Should this be a separate status column?

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Justin Cook"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"garthpmurray"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"4"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"jcook@globalrisksolutions.com"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1596043551502"},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprints","value":["July 27 - Aug 7"],"valueId":["July 27 - Aug 7"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"garthpmurray","fullName":"Garth Murray"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"Status Mapping.xlsx","id":"7-33","url":"https://youtrack.globalrisksolutions.com:443/api/files/7-33?sign=MTU5NjMyNjQwMDAwMHwxLTF8Ny0zM3w2VExXUGJIZllsMDc3M29NeEw1b25WbC1FZXdRcm5ySjlj%0D%0AbW1HZ0RxSWJrDQo%0D%0A&updated=1596043498775"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"4-116","author":"garthpmurray","authorFullName":"Garth Murray","issueId":"OD-89","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Modifying the status column so that it check to see if a field resource has been assigned, if so marks it as assigned. All other status will be fed by xact AFTER the dates of appointment, contacted, etc are pushed to Xactimate.

Received (This should be when we received the claim through XA. A desk adjuster should auto assign here.)
Assigned (This should be when the claim gets assigned to the Field inspector.)
Contacted (From Mobile)
Appointment (From Mobile)
Inspected (From Mobile)
Uploaded

Contact date/time, Appointment D/T and Inspected D/T are all collected in the mobile app and push into the DB. We need this data to: Need to poll mobile db to pull this

Push in to XA for each claim so the carrier sees this info Chris to build API

Push into GRS On Demand so we know what is going on with each file without having to go into XA each time Will happen automatically

Currently we have columns for Assigned, Appointment, Inspected and Completed. We need to add Contacted. Web app update needed

Appointment D/T are pushing through, but they are always 2 hours early. Maybe just a setting that needs to be updated.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595855773141,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-129","author":"rdupont","authorFullName":"Rick Dupont","issueId":"OD-92","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Is there somewhere else in the application that has a structure set up to use this ondemand API? I see in the OD-91 ticket that he says "Test/live API endpoints are the same as for attachments, notes, reassignment, and using the same API key:" but I'm not really familiar enough with the structure of the ondemand app to really recognize it. I see controllers and models like AssignmentsAPIController and UpdateClaimImagesRequest/UpdateClaimImagesAPIRequest but I'm not seeing any wrappers that seem to be setting up the API key.

My original plan was to just set up a quick CURL method to send the data to the API, and I have an API_KEY value in my .env file, but when I gave that a try I got a "Forbidden" response so I'm not sure if that's the right one.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1595862410312,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-130","author":"rdupont","authorFullName":"Rick Dupont","issueId":"OD-92","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Update: I found the existing KEY and wrapper for the OnDemand API. I just need a valid transaction_id for the test system to be able to actually test hitting the end point.
